00085 //================================================================================================
00086 // Constants for kvi_socket_create
00087 //
00088 
00089 #define KVI_SOCKET_PF_INET     PF_INET
00090 #define KVI_SOCKET_PF_INET6    PF_INET6
00091 #define KVI_SOCKET_PF_UNIX     PF_UNIX
00092 
00093 #define KVI_SOCKET_TYPE_STREAM SOCK_STREAM
00094 #define KVI_SOCKET_TYPE_DGRAM  SOCK_DGRAM
00095 
00096 #define KVI_SOCKET_PROTO_TCP   0
00097 
00098 //================================================================================================
00099 // kvi_socket_create
00100 // kvi_socket_open
00101 //
00102 //   Open a socket of the specified protocol family , type and protocol
00103 //   You should always use the KVI_SOCKET_* constants as parameters
00104 //   Returns KVI_INVALID_SOCKET if the socket creation has failed.
00105 //   The returned socket is in blocking mode!
00106 //
00107 
00108 #define kvi_socket_open kvi_socket_create
00109 
00110 inline kvi_socket_t kvi_socket_create(int pf,int type,int proto)
00111 {
00112         return (kvi_socket_t)socket(pf,type,proto);
00113 }
00114 
00115 //================================================================================================
00116 // kvi_socket_isValid
00117 //
00118 //   Check if a socket is valid or not
00119 //
00120 
00121 inline void kvi_socket_flushTrafficCounters()
00122 {
00123         g_uOutgoingTraffic = 0;
00124         g_uIncomingTraffic = 0;
00125 }
00126 
00127 inline bool kvi_socket_isValid(kvi_socket_t sock)
00128 {
00129         return (sock != ((kvi_socket_t)(KVI_INVALID_SOCKET)));
00130 }
00131 
00132 //================================================================================================
00133 // kvi_socket_destroy
00134 // kvi_socket_close
00135 //
00136 //   Close a socket...that's all :)
00137 //
00138 
00139 #define kvi_socket_close kvi_socket_destroy
00140 
00141 inline void kvi_socket_destroy(kvi_socket_t sock)
00142 {
00143 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00144         closesocket(sock);
00145 #else
00146         close(sock);
00147 #endif
00148 }
00149 
00150 //================================================================================================
00151 // kvi_socket_setNonBlocking
00152 //
00153 //   Sets the socket in nonBlocking mode. Obviously returns false in case of failure
00154 //
00155 
00156 inline bool kvi_socket_setNonBlocking(kvi_socket_t sock)
00157 {
00158 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00159         unsigned long arg = 1;
00160         return (ioctlsocket(sock,FIONBIO,(unsigned long FAR *)&arg) == 0);
00161 #else
00162         return (fcntl(sock,F_SETFL,O_NONBLOCK) == 0);
00163 #endif
00164 }
00165 
00166 //================================================================================================
00167 // kvi_socket_bind
00168 //
00169 //   Standard bind() call on the socket. Returns false in case of failure
00170 //
00171 
00172 inline bool kvi_socket_bind(kvi_socket_t sock,const struct sockaddr * sa,int salen)
00173 {
00174         return (::bind(sock,sa,salen) == 0);
00175 }
00176 
00177 //================================================================================================
00178 // kvi_socket_connect
00179 //
00180 //   Starts a connection to the specified remote address
00181 //   returns false if the connection can not be started.
00182 //   You might take a look at kvi_socket_errno() then.
00183 //
00184 
00185 inline bool kvi_socket_connect(kvi_socket_t sock,const struct sockaddr *sa,int salen)
00186 {
00187 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00188         return (WSAConnect(sock,sa,salen,0,0,0,0) == 0);
00189 #else
00190         return (::connect(sock,sa,salen) == 0);
00191 #endif
00192 }
00193 
00194 inline bool kvi_socket_recoverableConnectError(int err)
00195 {
00196 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00197         return ((err == WSAEINPROGRESS) || (err == WSAEWOULDBLOCK));
00198 #else
00199         return (err == EINPROGRESS);
00200 #endif
00201 }
00202 
00203 inline bool kvi_socket_recoverableError(int err)
00204 {
00205 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00206         return ((err == WSAEWOULDBLOCK) || (err == EINTR) || (err == EAGAIN));
00207 #else
00208         return ((err == EINTR) || (err == EAGAIN));
00209 #endif
00210 }
00211 
00212 //================================================================================================
00213 // kvi_socket_accept
00214 //
00215 //   Standard accept() call. Returns KVI_INVALID_SOCKET in case of failure
00216 //   You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00217 //
00218 
00219 inline kvi_socket_t kvi_socket_accept(kvi_socket_t sock,struct sockaddr *sa,int * salen)
00220 {
00221 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00222         return (kvi_socket_t)::accept(sock,sa,salen);
00223 #else
00224         return (kvi_socket_t)::accept(sock,sa,(socklen_t *)salen);
00225 #endif
00226 }
00227 
00228 //================================================================================================
00229 // kvi_socket_listen
00230 //
00231 //   Standard listen() call. Returns false in case of failure
00232 //   You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00233 //
00234 
00235 inline bool kvi_socket_listen(kvi_socket_t sock,int backlog)
00236 {
00237         return (::listen(sock,backlog) == 0);
00238 }
00239 
00240 //================================================================================================
00241 // kvi_socket_select
00242 //
00243 //   Standard select() call. This is complex so here is a mini-reminder:
00244 //   nhpo is the number of the highest file descriptor in the sets plus one!
00245 //   Returns the number of sockets with data available (or space available)
00246 //   or something that is less than 0 in case of error. You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00247 //
00248 
00249 inline int kvi_socket_select(int nhpo,fd_set *r,fd_set *w,fd_set *e,struct timeval * t)
00250 {
00251         return ::select(nhpo,r,w,e,t);
00252 }
00253 
00254 //================================================================================================
00255 // kvi_socket_send
00256 // kvi_socket_write
00257 //
00258 //   Standard send() call. On UNIX ignores SIGPIPE. Returns the number of bytes sent or
00259 //   -1 in case of failure. You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00260 //
00261 
00262 #define kvi_socket_write kvi_socket_send
00263 
00264 inline int kvi_socket_send(kvi_socket_t sock,const void * buf,int size)
00265 {
00266         g_uOutgoingTraffic+=size;
00267 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00268         return ::send(sock,(const char *)buf,size,0);
00269 #else
00270         return ::send(sock,buf,size,MSG_NOSIGNAL | MSG_DONTWAIT);
00271 #endif
00272 }
00273 
00274 //================================================================================================
00275 // kvi_socket_recv
00276 // kvi_socket_read
00277 //
00278 //   Standard read() call. On UNIX ignores SIGPIPE. Returns the number of bytes readed or
00279 //   -1 in case of failure. You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00280 //
00281 
00282 #define kvi_socket_read kvi_socket_recv
00283 
00284 inline int kvi_socket_recv(kvi_socket_t sock,void * buf,int maxlen)
00285 {
00286         int iReceived;
00287 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00288         iReceived = ::recv(sock,(char *)buf,maxlen,0);
00289 #else
00290         iReceived = ::recv(sock,buf,maxlen,MSG_NOSIGNAL);
00291 #endif
00292         g_uIncomingTraffic+=iReceived;
00293         return iReceived;
00294 }
00295 
00296 //================================================================================================
00297 // kvi_socket_getsockopt
00298 //
00299 //   Standard getsockopt() call. Returns false in case of failure.
00300 //   You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00301 //
00302 
00303 inline bool kvi_socket_getsockopt(kvi_socket_t sock,int level,int optname,void *optval,int *optlen)
00304 {
00305 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00306         return (::getsockopt(sock,level,optname,(char FAR *)optval,optlen) == 0);
00307 #else
00308         return (::getsockopt(sock,level,optname,optval,(socklen_t *)optlen) == 0);
00309 #endif
00310 }
00311 
00312 //================================================================================================
00313 // kvi_socket_setsockopt
00314 //
00315 //   Standard setsockopt() call. Returns false in case of failure.
00316 //   You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00317 //
00318 
00319 inline bool kvi_socket_setsockopt(kvi_socket_t sock,int level,int optname,const void *optval,int optlen)
00320 {
00321 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00322         return (::setsockopt(sock,level,optname,(char FAR *)optval,optlen) == 0);
00323 #else
00324         return (::setsockopt(sock,level,optname,optval,optlen) == 0);
00325 #endif
00326 }

00344 //================================================================================================
00345 // kvi_socket_getsockname
00346 //
00347 //   Standard getsockname() call. Returns false in case of failure.
00348 //   You should check kvi_socket_errno() then.
00349 //
00350 
00351 inline bool kvi_socket_getsockname(kvi_socket_t sock,struct sockaddr * addr,int * addrlen)
00352 {
00353 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00354         return (::getsockname(sock,addr,addrlen) == 0);
00355 #else
00356         return (::getsockname(sock,addr,(socklen_t *)addrlen) == 0);
00357 #endif
00358 }

00360 inline int kvi_socket_error()
00361 {
00362 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00363         return WSAGetLastError();
00364 #else
00365         return errno;
00366 #endif
00367 }
